page.title: 09THE SCHOOL
page.content: The school was closed and re-opened several times owing to lack of support.Children in those days were not compelled to attend school.In one of the log books there is a gap of 18 months.From March 1873 until June 1874.It was opened again in 1874 and 20 pupils left a nearby school and came to Garth School.The school wasn't the same as it is today.There used to be 1 school room to begin with and the master was complaining about the crammed state of the class room.The children used to write on slates with special pens.It wasn't until 1889 that standard 2 started to write on paper,and that was sixteen years after the school had opened.120 pupils were packed into the main room wich was only fixed for seating for 54 children.The school was enlarged in 1894,and then our class was added on.
